body:
It is obvious that the main purpose of the website is to have an alternative to reddit and its policies and I can see the potential within the community. Censorship-related content is necessary and often enlightening, however in order to create an engaging enviroment it would be nice to see smaller comunities grow and thrive.
The strenght reddit has lies within the communities and how they keep users engaged. Ruqqus already has some of them, don't get me wrong, but the only thing they lack is a consistent influx of users and a reliable "fanbase" that keeps them engaging for the incoming potential users.
Following guilds I find interesting in the "All" section works for me, and I reccomend it for new users. Don't get discouraged if you don't see a lot of activity, it's gonna need some time for the website to grow but I hope it can become a viable alternative to reddit.
Aight im done, peace

Users already here engaging non political/censorship related guild and B. More community oriented guilds (grinding for that sweet sweet rep to help with that atm)

post.body:
It is obvious that the main purpose of the website is to have an alternative to reddit and its policies and I can see the potential within the community. Censorship-related content is necessary and often enlightening, however in order to create an engaging enviroment it would be nice to see smaller comunities grow and thrive.
The strenght reddit has lies within the communities and how they keep users engaged. Ruqqus already has some of them, don't get me wrong, but the only thing they lack is a consistent influx of users and a reliable "fanbase" that keeps them engaging for the incoming potential users.
Following guilds I find interesting in the "All" section works for me, and I reccomend it for new users. Don't get discouraged if you don't see a lot of activity, it's gonna need some time for the website to grow but I hope it can become a viable alternative to reddit.
Aight im done, peace

body:
Which is inevitable. This is why the social media industry is winner takes all. The more established your website, the larger your userbase, the more content available for users. Which means smaller social media websites will always be at an inherent disadvantage.

I've considered making a handful of guilds. But I don't want to be irresponsible and create esoteric ones that won't be populated.

I theoretically *could* create +GameMaker but how many people are really going to migrate from the giant established communities? Almost none. The larger ones are simply better by virtue of being established.

Ruqqus already has some of them, don't get me wrong, but the only thing they lack is a consistent influx of users and a reliable "fanbase" that keeps them engaging for the incoming potential users. Following guilds I find interesting in the "All" section works for me, and I reccomend it for new users. Don't get discouraged if you don't see a lot of activity, it's gonna need some time for the website to grow but I hope it can become a viable alternative to reddit. Aight im done, peace
post.title: We should encourage communities that go beyond censorship-related content
